head.title: National Briefing | South: Louisiana: Jail For Court Clerk

hedline.hl1: National Briefing | South: Louisiana: Jail For Court Clerk

block.p: Kimberly Williamson Butler, the New Orleans clerk of criminal court who spent a week as a fugitive, was sentenced to three days in jail and fined $500 for contempt of court, WWL-TV reported. Ms. Butler had gone into hiding after refusing an order to give up some of her responsibilities in applying for federal money to clean up the flood-damaged courthouse. After turning herself in last week, she announced she was quitting her job to run for mayor.
